messages.content: As one of few MPs with a background in science, Julian is well placed to stand up for Cambridge's science and technology sector. Many people working at the science park, university, and elsewhere are worried about the impact Brexit will have. I was so disappointed when Labour supported the Conservatives to vote for Article 50. Here in Cambridge, where single market access is so vital for our economy, we need to send a strong message to Theresa May on Brexit – and supporting Julian seems the best way to do that.

Schools in Cambridgeshire are some of the lowest funded in the country. When he was MP for Cambridge, Julian fought a fair funding campaign which brought in millions of pounds of extra investment. But things are still tough and we need Julian's energy again to push for a fairer deal for schools here. It's not just his action on education funding that makes Julian such a great candidate to be our MP, he has lived here for decades – indeed, before he became an MP he was a local councillor here in Chesterton. He was one of the first people to campaign for a North Cambridge train station and has consistently called for increased funding in our NHS. He understands our city and the issues we face here.
